concept.title: Adding node credentials
concept.shortdesc: Add credentials to authenticate with nodes and fix vulnerabilities or gain insights into discovered resources. Each credential is encrypted and stored securely in the vault.

conbody.p: The two authentication methods are Secure Shell (SSH) authentication with Linux nodes on port 22, and Windows Remote Management (WinRM) authentication with Windows nodes on ports 5986 and 5985.

p.note: Using each node credential you provide, Puppet Remediate attempts to authenticate with each discovered node until a successful authentication is achieved. This process repeats every four hours, using previously successful credentials first. Depending on the configuration of your network management and security sensors, Remediate activities might trigger alerts or an active response.
